intro: Baeckea camphorosmae, commonly known as the camphorosma baeckea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring dense, aromatic foliage with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and a preference for well-drained soils in sunny or partially shaded environments. Baeckea camphorosmae is often found in coastal and sandy areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
